m_DescList: Internet Protocol version 4, commonly known as IPv4, consists of 4 numbers ranging from 0 to 255, connected by three ".".
For example, <color=#3c3cff>127.0.0.1</color> is a valid IPv4 address.
Sometimes users may mistakenly input invalid addresses, such as:
127.0.0.01  <color=#ee3300>X</color> Although "01" technically complies with the IPv4 definition, it does not conform to standard representation and is likely a user input error
The task is to help match valid IPv4 addresses.
To simplify the problem, the following conventions apply:
1. Each test case contains only 1 string to check
2. For 100% of test cases, numbers starting with 0 (two or three digits) will fail to match
Please construct a regular expression that passes all test cases on the right.
